noun.description: The action or practice of eating, or appearing to eat, flames (from a burning torch), burning coals, red-hot metal, etc., especially as a performance at a circus, fair, or similar entertainment.

adjective.description: That eats, or appears to eat, flames (from a burning torch), burning coals, red-hot metal, etc., especially as a performance at a circus, fair, or similar entertainment.
US. Designating an extreme Southern partisan advocating secession from the Union. See "fire-eater". Now historical.

origin: Mid 18th century; earliest use found in The Monthly Review. From fire + eating, after fire-eater<br>early 18th century. From fire + eating, after fire-eater.
